<label>16</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 531, 91]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a liquid-in-glass thermometer.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 98, 767, 141]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 154, 804, 174]]<|/det|>
A student wishes to check the marking of the upper fixed point on this thermometer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 185, 295, 203]]<|/det|>
What should she do?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 214, 134, 232]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 214, 520, 232]]<|/det|>
Put the bulb in a beaker of boiling sea water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 240, 133, 257]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>29</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A plastic rod is brought near to a small plastic sphere suspended from a stand. The sphere is repelled by the rod.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 117, 220, 134]]<|/det|>
Why is this?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 145, 133, 163]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 144, 500, 163]]<|/det|>
The rod and the sphere have like charges.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 171, 131, 190]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 170, 522, 189]]<|/det|>
The rod and the sphere have unlike charges.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 198, 133, 216]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 197, 556, 216]]<|/det|>
The rod is charged and the sphere is uncharged.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 223, 133, 242]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 222, 556, 241]]<|/det|>
The rod is uncharged and the sphere is charged.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 268, 106, 286]]<|/det|>
<label>30</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 268, 425, 286]]<|/det|>

<label>A</label>

A/Ω

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 297, 303, 314]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[311, 297, 356, 314]]<|/det|>
J/C

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 297, 470, 314]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[473, 297, 520, 314]]<|/det|>
J/s

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[615, 297, 636, 314]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[648, 297, 698, 314]]<|/det|>
W/C

<label>B</label>

20 s

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>37</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 688, 91]]<|/det|>
What is the purpose of the split-ring commutator in an electric motor?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 100, 133, 118]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 100, 826, 119]]<|/det|>
to ensure that the magnetic field in the motor changes direction every half rotation

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 127, 133, 144]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 125, 841, 144]]<|/det|>
to ensure that the magnetic field in the motor stays in the same direction at all times

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 153, 133, 170]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 152, 824, 170]]<|/det|>
to ensure that the turning effect on the motor changes direction every half rotation

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 178, 133, 196]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 178, 841, 196]]<|/det|>
to ensure that the turning effect on the motor stays in the same direction at all times

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 223, 107, 241]]<|/det|>
<label>38</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 222, 922, 256]]<|/det|>
How do the sizes of the two nuclei produced in a nuclear fission reaction compare to the size of the original nucleus?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 266, 133, 285]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 266, 450, 285]]<|/det|>
both larger than the original nucleus

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 293, 133, 312]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 293, 583, 310]]<|/det|>
one larger and one smaller than the original nucleus

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 319, 133, 337]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 319, 465, 337]]<|/det|>
both smaller than the original nucleus

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 345, 133, 364]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 345, 633, 363]]<|/det|>
one smaller and one the same size as the original nucleus

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 388, 707, 407]]<|/det|>
Which statement about the radioactive decay of a substance is correct?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 416, 133, 435]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 416, 640, 435]]<|/det|>
It cannot be predicted when a particular nucleus will decay.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 443, 133, 462]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 443, 823, 462]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 470, 534, 488]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 496, 695, 514]]<|/det|>
